problem_name: Life-Cycle Assessment of Embodied Carbon Emissions
description: Life-cycle assessment (LCA) is a method used to evaluate the environmental impacts associated with all stages of a product's life, from raw material extraction to disposal. In the context of embodied carbon emissions, LCA helps in understanding the total greenhouse gas emissions produced throughout the lifecycle of buildings and infrastructure.
you_have_this_if: You are involved in urban planning or construction projects.
You need to evaluate the sustainability of building materials.
You are required to report on carbon emissions for compliance.
You are interested in reducing the carbon footprint of a project.
You are assessing the environmental impact of design choices.

approaches.best_for: when assessing the environmental impact of new urban developments or sustainable building practices.
approaches.key_tradeoff: LCA provides comprehensive insights but can be resource-intensive.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a thorough evaluation of the environmental impacts of a product or building over its entire lifecycle.

start_here: Start with Life-Cycle Assessment (LCA) as it provides a detailed analysis of embodied carbon emissions and is essential for sustainable design practices.
